verses.roman:
sa labdhvā kāma-gaṁ yānaṁ
tamo-dhāma durāsadam
yayas dvāravatīṁ śālvo
vairaṁ vṛṣṇi-kṛtaṁ smaran

synonyms: saḥ—he; labdhvā—obtaining; kāma-gam—moving at his will; yānam—the vehicle; tamaḥ—of darkness; dhāma—abode; durāsadam—unapproachable; yayau—went; dvāravatīm—to Dvārakā; śālvaḥ—Śālva; vairam—the enmity; vṛṣṇi-kṛtam—shown by the Vṛṣṇis; smaran—remembering.
translation: This unassailable vehicle was filled with darkness and could go anywhere. Upon obtaining it, Śālva went to Dvārakā, remembering the Vṛṣṇis' enmity toward him.
